newsitem.title: UK: Earth has asteroid companion, study finds.
newsitem.headline: Earth has asteroid companion, study finds.

text.p: The Earth has another companion besides the moon -- an asteroid, astronomers reported on Wednesday.
Paul Wiegert of York University in Ontario and colleagues said the asteroid, five km (three miles) in diameter, followed an orbit locked to that of the Earth.
"Although it is not a satellite of the planet per se, it is, apart from the moon, the only known natural companion of the Earth," they wrote in a report in the science journal Nature.

The asteroid, dubbed 3753, follows a kidney bean-shaped orbit that crosses the Earth's at an angle. But the Earth's gravity affects it, pushing it away. "A possible collision with our planet is avoided," they wrote.
They said the origin of the asteroid was "an enigma".
"More detailed investigation of this object is clearly required; even the direct exploration of 3753 by spacecraft is presumably well within the reach of current technology," they added.dz
